metadata.title: CVE-2021-29338 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
Integer Overflow in OpenJPEG v2.4.0 allows remote attackers to crash theapplication, causing a Denial of Service (DoS). This occurs when theattacker uses the command line option "-ImgDir" on a directory thatcontains 1048576 files.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29338` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.4.0-6ubuntu0.2
libopenjp2-tools - 2.4.0-6ubuntu0.2
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.4.0-6ubuntu0.2
libopenjp3d7 - 2.4.0-6ubuntu0.2
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.4.0-6ubuntu0.2
libopenjpip-server - 2.4.0-6ubuntu0.2
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.4.0-6ubuntu0.2
libopenjpip7 - 2.4.0-6ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.0-6ubuntu0.2').
insighttoolkit4 package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
blender package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
texmaker package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
